entry.title: “Burnout amongst health care workers, especially in the ICU...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Burnout amongst health care workers, especially in the ICU pre-pandemic was at epidemic proportions already,” Anuj Mehta, a pulmonologist at National Jewish Health, told the station. “And it's only worse now. It's going to be a reckoning that we all have to face.”

The University of Colorado is now using federal grants to provide free mental health assistance for medical employees, including through support groups, individual counseling and a multipart series on resiliency.”

Colorado Politics

Healthcare workers in Colorado and elsewhere are warning about increased levels of stress, anxiety and burnout due to the COVID-19 pandemic, CPR reports.

coloradopolitics.com

Report: Pandemic contributing to burnout among healthcare workers

Healthcare workers in Colorado and elsewhere are warning about increased levels of stress, anxiety and burnout due to the COVID-19 pandemic, CPR reports.Healthcare workers in Colorado and elsewhere are warning about increased levels of stress, anxiety and burnout due to the COVID-19 pandemic, CPR reports.

entry.title: “Starting Monday, citizens can watch live 24-hour camera...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Starting Monday, citizens can watch live 24-hour camera footage from the room where Denver ballots are received and counted at Denvervotes.org. The camera won’t be close enough to identify individual ballots or disclose voter information.”
The Colorado Sun

Starting Monday, citizens can watch live 24-hour camera footage from the room where Denver ballots are received and counted at Denvervotes.org

entry.title: “The directive, right now, is set to expire on Oct. 12. At a...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The directive, right now, is set to expire on Oct. 12. At a news conference on Friday, Polis said he will keep it going for at least another 30 days, urging Coloradans to abide by the mandate.

“Just wear a mask,” he said. “This is simple.”

The Colorado Sun

The directive is set to expire on Oct. 12. At a news conference on Friday, the governor said he will keep it going for at least another 30 days.

coloradosun.com

Jared Polis says Colorado’s mask mandate will continue into November

The directive is set to expire on Oct. 12. At a news conference on Friday, the governor said he will keep it going for at least another 30 days.The directive is set to expire on Oct. 12. At a news conference on Friday, the governor said he will keep it going for at least another 30 days.

entry.title: “It’s a new era in technology for the community mental...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“It’s a new era in technology for the community mental health center, a key step toward “preparing for the next generation,” said Alires Almon, the center’s director of innovation. The 12-week, virtual therapy program isn’t meant to replace traditional face-to-face counseling — it’s a contemporary option for people who would rather work on their mental health at home with their smartphone than walk into a mental health center.”

The Colorado Sun

The Mental Health Center of Denver is partnering with a health tech company to prepare for the next generation of therapy, happening on smartphones

coloradosun.com

Beyond Zoom: Virtual therapy’s next generation has Bluetooth pulse monitors and more

The Mental Health Center of Denver is partnering with a health tech company to prepare for the next generation of therapy, happening on smartphonesThe Mental Health Center of Denver is partnering with a health tech company to prepare for the next generation of therapy, happening on smartphones

entry.title: “This feels like a particular time in our country when an...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“This feels like a particular time in our country when an emphasis on voting and civic engagement is important,” he said, referring to how the COVID-19 pandemic and a nationwide reckoning on racism have highlighted societal inequities. Students at STRIVE Prep RISE high school organized a march against racism and police violence in June.”

Chalkbeat Colorado

Students and staff at STRIVE Prep’s 11 schools in Denver won’t have school on Nov. 3.

co.chalkbeat.org

Denver charter school network gives students and staff Election Day off

entry.title: “Faced with rising hospitalizations and concern that COVID-19...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Faced with rising hospitalizations and concern that COVID-19 is continuing to spread in Colorado, Gov. Jared Polis said Friday that a mandatory mask requirement would continue and be extended for at least another 30 days.”

Colorado Public Radio

Polis emphasized that the infection may impact older populations at a higher rate, but has resulted in hospitalizations for every age group.

cpr.org

entry.title: “In short: The signatures required on the outside of the...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“In short: The signatures required on the outside of the envelope used to return your mail ballot confirm that the right voter filled out the ballot. They’re matched most often by a bipartisan team of two election judges, and if there’s a problem, the voter has a chance to fix it.”

The Colorado Sun

Colorado election officials begin mailing ballots to registered active voters Friday. To verify them, election officials check the signature on the envelope.

coloradosun.com

Colorado election officials must verify a voter’s signature to count a ballot. Here’s how it works.

Colorado election officials begin mailing ballots to registered active voters Friday. To verify them, election officials check the signature on the envelope.Colorado election officials begin mailing ballots to registered active voters Friday. entry.title: Representative Leslie HerodFireside at Five was live.Join Fireside at Five and The University of Denver for Chat 2 of The Future of Denver...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie HerodFireside at Five was live.

Join Fireside at Five and The University of Denver for Chat 2 of The Future of Denver Series.

In continuation of our Equitable Development and The Future of De...nver Series, join Fireside at Five and the University of Denver as we dive back into the issues and opportunities surrounding equitable development in the city of Denver. 2020 has been a challenging year for everyone and as we push forward into a brighter future, we must ask how we can stimulate and support diverse small businesses, eliminate neighborhood insecurities, push back on systemic limitations for growth, and holistically address the needs of all our community members. We look forward to tackling these issues and discussing Denver’s infinite potential on this upcoming Fireside Chat. Whether you’re a big thinker, local beer drinker, or you just want to see people on I-25 using their blinkers -- register for the live-stream and get ready for some great discussion!

Panelists:
Kara Penn - Owner & Principal Consultant of Mission Spark

Representative Leslie Herod - Colorado House of Representatives, House District 8

Mark Shaker - Founder of Stanley Marketplace and Broadway Market

Rob Smith - CEO of Rocky Mountain MicroFinance Institute

Dr. Tom Romero - Interim Vice Chancellor for the Office of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at The University of Denver

See More

entry.title: “Confusing forms for gig workers and the self-employed had...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Confusing forms for gig workers and the self-employed had many applicants overstating their earnings, which were supposed to be based on adjusted earnings and not gross income. Because of that — and the number of Coloradans hit with overpayments — state officials launched a focus group last month to figure out what went wrong and on Oct. 29, will issue a revised form, with clearer language, for new applicants.”

The Colorado Sun

Confusing forms in the federal Pandemic Unemployment Assistance program led some gig workers to overestimate their income.

coloradosun.com

Colorado won’t try to collect the $1.4 million in overpaid unemployment benefits it distributed after all

Confusing forms in the federal Pandemic Unemployment Assistance program led some gig workers to overestimate their income.Confusing forms in the federal Pandemic Unemployment Assistance program led some gig workers to overestimate their income.

entry.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine
